archimate:Product.name: Derivative
archimate:Product.documentation:
A derivative is a contract whose value is based on an agreed-upon underlying financial asset common examples of derivative instruments are Forwards, Futures, Options and Swaps.
A forward contract is a customized contract between two parties, where settlement takes place on a specific date in future at a price agreed today. option is a contract which gives the buyer (the owner or holder of the option) the right, but not the obligation, to buy or sell an underlying asset or instrument at a specified strike price on a specified date.
